events.originalText: A building collapsed on tribal land in Mumbra, a suburb of Thane in Maharashtra, India, causing 74 deaths.
events.subtitle: 2013 Thane building collapse
events.headline: Building collapse in Mumbra, India kills 74

events.originalText: Governor of Arizona Evan Mecham was removed from office after being convicted in his impeachment trial.
events.subtitle: Evan Mecham
events.headline: Arizona Governor Evan Mecham removed from office

events.originalText: Vietnam War: On a mission to evacuate children from South Vietnam, a U.S. Air Force plane crash-landed at Tan Son Nhut Air Base, killing 78 children and 60 others.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: U.S. Air Force plane crash kills 78 children in Vietnam War mission

events.originalText: Bill Gates and Paul Allen founded Microsoft in Albuquerque, New Mexico, to develop and sell BASIC interpreters for the Altair 8800.
events.subtitle: Bill Gates
events.headline: Bill Gates and Paul Allen found Microsoft in New Mexico

events.originalText: The World Trade Center in New York City was officially dedicated, about a year after the second of the building complex's twin towers was completed.
events.subtitle: World Trade Center (1973–2001)
events.headline: World Trade Center in NYC officially dedicated

events.originalText: American civil rights leader Martin Luther King Jr. (pictured) was assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee.
events.subtitle: Civil rights movement
events.headline: Martin Luther King Jr. assassinated in Memphis

events.originalText: Twelve nations signed the North Atlantic Treaty, establishing NATO, an organization that constitutes a system of collective defense whereby its member states agree to mutual defense in response to an attack by any external party.
events.subtitle: North Atlantic Treaty
events.headline: NATO established with signing of North Atlantic Treaty

events.originalText: An earthquake hit the Kangra Valley in India, killing more than 20,000 people and destroying most buildings in Kangra, McLeod Ganj, and Dharamshala.
events.subtitle: 1905 Kangra earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Kangra Valley, India kills over 20,000

events.originalText: An earthquake hit the Kangra Valley in India, killing at least 20,000 people and destroying 100,000 buildings.
events.subtitle: 1905 Kangra earthquake
events.headline: Kennel Club founded in UK

events.originalText: The Kennel Club, the world's oldest kennel club, was founded in the United Kingdom after Sewallis Shirley became frustrated by trying to organise dog shows without a consistent set of rules.
events.subtitle: The Kennel Club
events.headline: Russian tsar Alexander II survives assassination attempt

events.originalText: Russian tsar Alexander II narrowly survived an assassination attempt by Dmitry Karakozov.
events.subtitle: Alexander II of Russia
events.headline: Minstrel song 'Dixie' premiered in New York City

events.originalText: Bryant's Minstrels premiered the minstrel song "Dixie" in New York City as part of their blackface show.
events.subtitle: Bryant's Minstrels
events.headline: President William Henry Harrison dies in office

events.originalText: William Henry Harrison (pictured) became the first U.S. president to die in office, sparking a brief constitutional crisis regarding questions of presidential succession that were unanswered by the U.S. Constitution.
events.subtitle: William Henry Harrison
events.headline: Byzantine Empire and Republic of Venice sign treaty

events.originalText: The Byzantine Empire and the Republic of Venice signed a treaty that brought seven years of hostilities to a temporary end.
events.subtitle: Byzantine Empire
events.headline: Komnenos dynasty comes to power in Byzantine Empire

events.originalText: The Byzantine Empire and the Republic of Venice signed a five-year peace treaty.
events.subtitle: Byzantine Empire

events.originalText: The Komnenos dynasty came to full power with Alexios I Komnenos's coronation as the Byzantine emperor.
events.subtitle: Komnenos
